name: National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2013. Coal shuttle car; Manufacture; For underground mine, at plant; 28.6 metric tonnes
description:
DESCRIPTION
This unit process considers the amount of steel used in the construction of one shuttle car to be used to haul coal from the working mine face to the conveyor belt.									

CITATION AND ASSOCIATED DOCUMENTATION
This document should be cited as: 
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2013. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data – Source: Coal shuttle car; Manufacture; At point-of-sale. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: September 2008 (version 01). Retrieved on [DATE] from [URL for this dataset].

This dataset is part of the NETL Unit Process Library.  The Library offers additional information concerning this dataset in the form of a Detailed Spreadsheet  Documentation (DS) file and a Process Documentation File (DF).  The DS file  is an Excel file that contains all of the parameters, inputs, and outputs for a given system as well as background data, calculations and quality scores.  The DF file is a PDF document that contains major assumptions and data sources that are the basis for each unit process.  The NETL Unit Process Library is located on the NETL website (netl.doe.gov) under Research / Energy Analysis / Energy Trends and Issues / Life Cycle Analysis / Unit Process Library.

Full citations for the DS and DF are given below.

DS File
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2013. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data – Unit Process: Coal shuttle car; Manufacture; At point-of-sale. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: September 2008 (version 01). Retreived on 06/30/2014 through personal correspondence with NETL.

DF File
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2013. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data – Unit Process: Coal shuttle car; Manufacture; At point-of-sale. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: September 2008 (version 01). Retreived on 06/30/2014 through personal correspondence with NETL.
